private_information: Focus on predicates, operator preconditions and effects, and invariant structure.
Do not emit PDDL; provide normalized summaries only.
domain_analyst.goal: Extract and normalize the operator schemas and predicate signatures from the public information, highlighting action dependencies and potential invariants.

private_information: Skilled at validating plans and reasoning about causal links and open preconditions.
Do not emit PDDL; provide reasoning, checks, and action instance outlines only.
state_planner.goal: Using the domain summary, validate the provided plan for Scenario A at the level of preconditions and effects, and produce a high-level achievement outline for Scenario B.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the domain summary and planning analysis to produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem (targeting FastDownward) for Scenario B.

public_information: Operator paltry(x0,x1,x2): preconditions = { hand x0, cats x1, texture x2, vase x0 x1, next x1 x2 }; add = { next x0 x2 }; del = { vase x0 x1 }.
Operator sip(x0,x1,x2): preconditions = { hand x0, cats x1, texture x2, next x0 x2, next x1 x2 }; add = { vase x0 x1 }; del = { next x0 x2 }.
Operator clip(x0,x1,x2): preconditions = { hand x0, sneeze x1, texture x2, next x1 x2, next x0 x2 }; add = { vase x0 x1 }; del = { next x0 x2 }.
Operator wretched(x0,x1,x2,x3): preconditions = { sneeze x0, texture x1, texture x2, stupendous x3, next x0 x1, collect x1 x3, collect x2 x3 }; add = { next x0 x2 }; del = { next x0 x1 }.
Operator memory(x0,x1,x2): preconditions = { cats x0, spring x1, spring x2, next x0 x1 }; add = { next x0 x2 }; del = { next x0 x1 }.
Operator tightfisted(x0,x1,x2): preconditions = { hand x0, sneeze x1, texture x2, next x1 x2, vase x0 x1 }; add = { next x0 x2 }; del = { vase x0 x1 }.

Scenario A (Statement 1) initial facts: { cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_9, next object_3 object_7, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9 }.
Scenario A goal facts: { next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_10 }.

Scenario A proposed plan: clip object_11 object_4 object_10; wretched object_3 object_7 object_6 object_1; clip object_12 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_5 object_1; tightfisted object_12 object_3 object_5; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_11 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_9 object_2; clip object_13 object_4 object_9; wretched object_4 object_9 object_10 object_2; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_10; memory object_0 object_8 object_5; sip object_12 object_0 object_5; memory object_0 object_5 object_8; paltry object_12 object_0 object_8.

Scenario B (Statement 2) initial facts: { cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_7, next object_13 object_7, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_9, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9 }.
Scenario B goal facts: { next object_11 object_5, next object_12 object_9, next object_13 object_10 }.
Notes: single type obj; use STRIPS add/delete effects; no derived predicates; preserve operator and predicate names exactly as listed.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain-analysis expert for classical planning. Do not emit PDDL. Extract the signature of predicates and operators, normalize parameter names and roles, identify apparent invariants (e.g., which actions toggle next or vase), and list enabling dependencies among actions.
analysis.prompt: Your name is domain_analyst. Use the public information to construct a concise, self-contained summary of the domain for the other agents. Include: (1) predicate signatures with arities, (2) operator schemas with preconditions/adds/dels, (3) dependencies among operators (which facts make others applicable), (4) any candidate invariants or mutexes you can infer, (5) a short note about object universes. Do not write PDDL. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your goal: {agents->domain_analyst->goal}. Your private notes: {agents->domain_analyst->private_information}.

scenario_plans.system_prompt: You are a plan analyst. Do not emit PDDL. Validate plans against operator preconditions/effects and reason about causal links and open conditions.
scenario_plans.prompt: Your name is state_planner. Using the domain summary, first evaluate the proposed plan for Scenario A: check step-by-step applicability and whether the stated goals are achieved; if an action is inapplicable, state the missing preconditions and suggest minimal repairs. Then, for Scenario B, outline a high-level strategy: list key subgoals, operator instances likely needed (by name and object tuples), and an indicative ordering with causal links. Do not produce PDDL. Inputs: {domain_summary}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your goal: {agents->state_planner->goal}. Your private notes: {agents->state_planner->private_information}.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL and the FastDownward solver. Produce a clean STRIPS PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for Scenario B. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Use a single type obj, list all objects, encode initial and goal facts exactly as stated, and transcribe operator schemas with their preconditions and add/delete effects using the same predicate and action names.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the domain summary and the scenario assessment to produce a final PDDL package targeting FastDownward. Requirements: (1) Domain: name it mystery-blocksworld-25, define type obj, define predicates {hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring}, and encode the six operators paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted exactly as in the public info (parameter ordering, preconditions, add, delete). (2) Problem: name it scenario-b, reference the domain, declare all objects object_0..object_13 as type obj, initialize exactly the Scenario B initial facts, and set the goal to Scenario B goals. (3) Ensure STRIPS style compatible with FastDownward (no quantified effects, no negative preconditions, no derived predicates). Enclose outputs within <domain> and <problem> tags only. Inputs available: {domain_summary}, {scenario_assessment}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Global objective: {agents->orchestrator->goal}.
